recipe.name: Apple & Blackberry Crumble
recipe.description: A classic British dessert featuring tender apples and juicy blackberries topped with a buttery crumble, served warm with vanilla ice cream.
steps: Preheat the oven to 190°C (170°C fan) or gas mark 5.
In a large bowl, combine the plain flour and caster sugar.
Add 60g of butter to the flour mixture and rub in using your fingertips until it resembles light breadcrumbs. Be careful not to overwork to keep the crumble light.
Spread the crumble mixture evenly over a baking sheet and bake for 15 minutes or until lightly golden. Set aside.
Peel, core, and dice the Braeburn apples into 2cm pieces.
In a medium saucepan, melt 30g of butter with the demerara sugar over medium heat until it forms a light caramel, about 3 minutes.
Stir in the diced apples and cook for an additional 3 minutes.
Add the blackberries and cinnamon to the pan, cooking for another 3 minutes.
Remove from heat, cover, and let sit for 2-3 minutes to allow the fruit to soften further.
Transfer the warm fruit mixture to an ovenproof gratin dish.
Top with the pre-baked crumble mixture.
Return to the oven and bake for 5-10 minutes until the crumble is heated through.
Serve warm with vanilla ice cream.
Well done! Serve and savor every bite.
